description.p: You send a shockwave to an enemy within 10 feet. The target makes a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they take 1d6 force damage and are pushed back 15 feet.
At Higher Levels At 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 15th level (4d8).

You launch a sphere wreathed in blue flames on the outside and red within at a target. If your ranged spell attack hits, the target takes 2d6 fire damage and 2d6 cold damage. The target’s movement speed is reduced by 10 feet.
At Higher LevelsWhen you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the fire and cold damage each increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You release a wave of ice from the ground beneath anyone who comes within 15 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2d8 cold damage and be restrained by the encasing ice until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes only half damage.
The area within a 10-foot radius centered on the spell’s origin becomes difficult terrain. A creature can use its action to make a Strength saving throw to break free from the ice prison.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the cold damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

You imbue a pawn chess piece with magic and send it into battle. The spell ends early if you become incapacitated, lose concentration, or if its hp becomes 0. When it ends, the pawn reverts to its chess piece form.

The pawn appears in a location within 45 feet and is friendly to you. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required). It acts immediately after your turn or rolls its own initiative. If given no orders, it only takes the Dodge action to protect itself.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, the pawn gains enhanced stats according to its stat block.
You touch a creature within range and surround their body with an invisible barrier. While you maintain concentration, the creature takes only half damage from spells.

You imbue a knight chess piece with magic and summon a mounted warrior at a point within 60 feet. The spell ends early if you become incapacitated, lose concentration, or if its Health drops to zero, at which point it reverts to a chess piece.
The knight obeys your verbal commands (no action required). If not commanded, it defends itself but takes no other actions. It acts on your initiative count directly after you, or rolls separately.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level or higher spell slot, the knight gains improved stats as described in its stat block.

You imbue a bishop chess piece with magic and summon a holy warrior at a point within 60 feet. The spell ends if you become incapacitated, lose concentration, or if its Health drops to zero, returning the bishop to its original form.

The bishop follows your verbal commands without requiring an action. If given no instructions, it protects itself but takes no other action. It acts on your initiative directly after your turn, or rolls its own.
At Higher Levels: When cast with a 4th-level or higher spell slot, the bishop receives enhancements as described in its stat block.

You fire a beam of icy blue light into the sky. From a height of 60 feet, shards of shattered, glass-like ice rain down on a 15-foot radius area of your choosing. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3d6 cold damage and 1d6 piercing damage and their movement speed is reduced by 10 feet. On a successful save, they take half damage and suffer no movement penalty.
On subsequent turns, you may re-cast the spell as an action or move the blizzard by up to 20 feet.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, both the piercing and cold damage increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

A 20-foot-diameter black sphere appears in an area. Creatures inside are overwhelmed by despair and hear screaming voices in their minds. They must make a Wisdom saving throw; on a failure, they take 5d8 psychic damage and become frightened until they succeed the save or leave the area. Their movement speed is halved while affected.
Creatures that are deafened are immune to this spell.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

setters.set: A vial of blood from an elven woman who died in rage

description.p: A fiery eruption bursts from the ground in a 30-foot-diameter area, dealing 12d8 fire damage. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take full damage; on a success, they take half.
Casting this spell requires both your actions and movement for two consecutive turns.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 2d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

You intensify the flow of magical energy around a willing creature, making them more receptive to magical effects. They receive an additional 2d10 benefit from magical healing or magical damage effects targeting them.

setters.set: An item the creature is currently wearing or wielding

description.p: You enchant a rook chess piece and summon a heavily armored knight at a point within 90 feet. The spell ends early if you become incapacitated, lose concentration, or its duration expires. The knight then reverts back to its chess piece form.
The rook follows your commands without requiring your action. If not commanded, it takes only the Dodge action. It acts immediately after your turn or rolls for its own initiative.

You enchant a queen chess piece and summon a powerful queen warrior at a point within 90 feet. The spell ends early if you become incapacitated, lose concentration, or its duration expires. The queen then reverts to its original chess piece form.
The queen follows your commands without using your action. If you don’t issue any, she defaults to defending herself. She acts immediately after your turn or rolls her own initiative.

You bring your hands together and form a magma-like fireball. You hurl it at a creature within range, making a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 10d10 fire damage and begins burning. At the start of each of their turns, they take 1d10 additional fire damage until someone uses an action to extinguish the flames with a successful Dexterity check against your spell save DC.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot above 7th, the initial fire damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 7th.

You merge your soul with a magically enhanced king chess piece, transforming it into a sovereign warrior. Due to a divine pact, the king cannot be dispelled by dispel magic or antimagic field. If the king dies, you die. If you dismiss the spell before fulfilling its purpose, you die as well.
When summoned, all previously known chess piece spells are instantly cast at specific levels: Pawn (3rd), Bishop (5th), Knight (5th), Rook (6th), and Queen (7th).
Upon transforming into the king, you gain access to special abilities:
Master Strategist (Action): The king surveys the battlefield. Until the end of the round, allies gain advantage on their first attack roll and +10 movement speed.
King's Will (Aura): All summoned chess pieces have advantage on saving throws against spells.

Mind Game (Bonus Action): The king clouds the mind of a creature within 60 feet. It must succeed an Intelligence saving throw or become disoriented, interpreting directions incorrectly (e.g., left becomes forward). This also affects ranged attacks. The saving throw repeats at the end of each of the creature’s turns.
Pawn to Queen (Action): If the queen is dead and a pawn is still alive, the pawn may sacrifice itself to resurrect the queen. The queen's HP equals the pawn’s missing HP.

setters.set: King chess piece, pact oath, worth 1000 gp

description.p: You imbue a nonmagical ship with arcane energy by touch. The ship cannot exceed 200 feet in length or 50 feet in width. For the duration, it gains a flying speed of 80 feet and follows your commands until given new ones. The ship has an AC of 16 and 400 hit points.

It is immune to poison and psychic damage, and to all conditions. It can carry up to 140 tons. It is not slowed by encumbrance unless overloaded—in that case, it falls 80 feet per round, affected by feather fall.
If this spell is cast once daily for a full month without interruption, the ship becomes permanently enchanted.

setters.set: A toy ship carved from wood

element.name: Shadowcrash
element.description:
A beam of darkness descends from the sky onto your target area. It affects a 40-foot-radius, 200-foot-high cylinder. All within the area take 7d10 necrotic and 7d10 force damage instantly.
A 600-foot area around the impact is covered in magical darkness, which can only be dispelled by a 9th-level daylight spell. Creatures killed by this effect leave no remains, consumed by oblivion.
Creatures in the area take 1d10 necrotic damage at the start of each turn.
If the area remains active for 1 week, a two-way portal to the void opens at its center.>

description.p: Your weapon surges with energy and fires three beams of lightning. Make a ranged spell attack for each beam. Each hit deals 4d10 lightning damage. If all three beams hit the same target, a surge of power forces the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take an additional 3d10 lightning damage and are paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

You extend necrotic energy to boil the blood of living beings around you. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3d6 fire and 3d6 necrotic damage. On a success, they take half damage. Creatures without blood or vital fluids are unaffected.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 3rd-level spell slot or higher, both damage types increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

You summon a cage of icy chains around a target within 30 feet, rising from the ground to trap them. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or become restrained, unable to move. While restrained, the creature can only cast spells that require verbal components, maintain existing spells, or command summoned creatures verbally or mentally.

At the start of each turn spent inside, the target makes a Strength saving throw. For every 2 failed rounds inside, they gain 1 level of exhaustion (up to 3). They also take 1d8 cold damage per turn inside.
The cage can be broken by physical damage, but not mental or psychic effects.
Teleportation and displacement spells cannot be used while inside the cage.

You play a sorrowful melody of hopeless love that charms one creature within 90 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall into despair. Until the end of its next turn, its AC is reduced by 1 and it has disadvantage on saving throws against being charmed. Until it lands a successful attack, all its attack rolls are made with disadvantage.
The target takes 1d8 psychic damage upon being affected and again at the start of its next turn.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, the psychic damage increases by 1d8 per slot level above 2nd.

You play a loud and mind-shaking chord targeting one creature within 60 feet. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes 2d8 thunder damage and becomes stunned and deafened until the end of its next turn.
Creatures that are deaf or immune to thunder damage are unaffected by this spell.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, the damage increases by 1d8 per slot level above 2nd.

You infuse a creature within range with revitalizing energy through music. The target regains hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier and gains a +3 bonus to Strength- or Dexterity-based damage rolls until the end of their turn.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 3rd-level or higher spell slot, the healing increases by 1d8 per level. For every 3 levels above 2nd, the damage bonus increases by an additional +1.
You play your instrument, filling the air with a lively rhythm. All creatures of your choice who hear it and are affected gain the following benefits for the duration:
Their movement speed increases by 10 feet, they have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and their Dexterity modifier increases by +1. Their movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

You unleash a powerful sonic blast in a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall area you choose within range. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, they take 4d6 psychic damage, fall prone, and become deafened. On a success, they take only half damage.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 per slot level above 3rd.
Ancient poems and songs praising legendary heroes echo in the minds of creatures of your choice within 30 feet.

While you maintain concentration, affected creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier at the start of each turn. They also become immune to the frightened and confusion conditions, and gain +2 to attack rolls, damage rolls, and AC.

Music from the Feywild fills a 25-foot radius, 50-foot-tall cylinder that extends up to 45 feet high. The melody soothes creatures of your choice, but sounds terrifying and chaotic to others. You can move the area up to 20 feet as a bonus action. While inside, chosen creatures gain the following benefits:
1: Regain 3d8 hit points per turn.
2: Have one condition removed per turn.
3: Gain resistance to psychic damage.
Creatures not chosen must make a Wisdom saving throw each turn they enter or start their turn in the area. On a failed save:
1: They take 3d8 psychic damage.
2: Their movement speed is halved.
3: They randomly attack a creature within range.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 7th-level or higher slot, healing and damage increase by 1d8 and the movement range increases by 10 feet.

You channel continuous purple necrotic energy through your hands into a target's soul. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 damage. On each of your turns while concentrating, you may use a bonus action to attack again. If you miss, you must use your action to maintain the link. If you perform any other action, the spell ends.
The spell ends if the target gains total cover or moves out of range.
This crystal can be used as a material component for some warlock spells but is otherwise worthless and disintegrates if altered.
If the target dies while affected, even by another source, a soul crystal appears in your hand.
Damage increases at level 5 (2d4), 11 (3d4), and 17 (4d4).
You drain a creature's life force, drawing green energy from their eyes and mouth into your hand. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d12 necrotic damage.

While concentrating, you may repeat the attack each turn as an action. You heal for half the amount of damage dealt each time. If you take any other action, the spell ends. The spell also ends if the target moves out of range or gains total cover. Undead and constructs are immune to this effect.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 2nd-level or higher spell slot, the damage increases by 1d12 per level above 1st.

p.b: This spell cannot be learned by non-warlocks.

description.p: You open a rift into the void, from which a claw of darkness lashes out at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d12 necrotic damage. If the target is under the effect of *hex*, your critical hit range for this attack increases by 1.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 2nd.
Starting at 5th level, if the target is affected by *hex*, your critical hit range increases to 18–20.

You summon four hovering orbs of black flame around you. These orbs strike designated creatures within range. Each creature makes a Dexterity saving throw once against all the orbs. On a failed save, they take 3d6 damage per orb in either fire or necrotic type, chosen when the spell is cast.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you summon one additional orb for each slot level above 3rd.

element.name: Create Soulwell
element.description:
You begin a summoning ritual, forming a black-and-green portal. Allies with magical power may help shorten the ritual: each helper can take 1d6 damage to reduce the ritual time by 1 minute.
At the end of the ritual, the portal disappears, leaving behind an altar embedded in the ground with a recess containing green mist.
A creature can insert its hand into the mist to withdraw a green soul crystal. Even if the altar is destroyed, the crystal lasts for 24 hours.
As a bonus action, a creature can crush the crystal to regain 4d10 + your Warlock spellcasting modifier hit points. That creature cannot benefit from another soul crystal for 24 hours.>

description.p: You extract the magical properties of a magical weapon and store them in a soul crystal. You can later transfer these properties into your *Pact of the Blade* weapon, allowing it to gain the magical weapon's traits regardless of class or alignment restrictions. Only one such enhancement can be active at a time.
Once a property is stored, it cannot be removed unless overwritten by a new one. Only weapons of *uncommon* rarity or lower can be used initially.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a 4th-level spell slot, *rare* weapons can be used. At 5th level, *very rare* weapons become valid.

p.b: Only valid for Pact of the Blade feature. Cannot be acquired through Ritual Caster feat.

description.p: You invoke the abyssal hunger of the void. As long as you are conscious and concentrating, this aura allows you to detect nearby souls and leech their energy. The spell ends if you fall unconscious, end it, or after its full duration.

Creatures (excluding constructs) that start their turn within 10 feet of you or enter that area must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, they take 2d8 necrotic damage. You gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt, stacking only with itself.

Once you accumulate at least 50 temporary HP from this spell, you can use a bonus action—or automatically after 5 turns—to detonate. Each creature within 20 feet makes a Constitution saving throw. On a fail, they take damage equal to the total stored temporary HP. On a success, they take half. The spell then ends.

Your weapon glows with radiant light and you make a melee attack against a target. On a hit, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage, and until the end of their turn, the light lingers on them. The next melee weapon attack made against them heals the attacker for 1d4 hit points.
At 5th level: 2d6 damage / 2d4 healing. At 11th: 3d6 / 3d4. At 15th: 4d6 / 4d4.
As a reaction, you grant a creature that just made a saving throw a d4. Until the end of their next turn, they may add this die to a saving throw of their choice. Once used, the die disappears.

You hurl a shield made of light in the likeness of your own toward a target within 45 feet, making a ranged spell attack. The shield ricochets to another target within 20 feet of the original. If the attack does not exceed the AC of the target, it ends. The first hit deals 2d8 damage, and ricochets deal 1d8 each. Each target hit must make a Constitution saving throw or be Dazzled: they cannot take reactions and have their movement halved until the end of their next turn.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage of both initial and ricochet hits increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st. Maximum casting level is 5th.

You infuse a feather with divine energy, creating three angelic feathers. These feathers can be crushed as a bonus action to give the user the effects of a dash, disengage, or stealth action until the end of their turn. The feathers remain active for 1 hour after being created.

You brand a target within range with a holy mark. While the spell lasts, whenever the marked creature receives healing, it regains additional hit points equal to the healing roll + your spellcasting modifier. The spell ends if the target leaves your range.

You release a divine explosion of radiant energy. Allies within a 15-foot radius of you are healed for 2d6 hit points, while enemies in the same area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take 2d6 radiant damage.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, both healing and damage increase by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

You target a creature within range. For 1 minute, they are protected by a spiritual shield with 12 HP. After being affected, they are soul-marked and cannot be shielded again by this spell for 5 rounds.
When cast at 3rd level or higher, the shield gains +7 HP for each level beyond 2nd, and the soul-mark duration is reduced by 1 round (to a minimum of 2 rounds).

You assault a target’s mental defenses. The creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, it takes 3d6 psychic damage and becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. On a success, it takes half damage. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the frightened condition.
At Higher Levels: For each level above 2nd, the damage increases by 1d6.

Your body and gear shimmer with crystalline light. You dash up to 30 feet in a direction with an empty path. Opportunity attacks made against you during this dash are at disadvantage. Crystals are left behind along the path.
Creatures on the path make a DEX saving throw or take 1d8 piercing damage and lose 10 feet of movement. On a success, they take half damage.
Walking on the crystal path causes damage per 5 feet equal to the spell's level.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 damage and +5 feet range per level above 2nd.

You create a 20-foot area explosion of radiant crystal shards at a point within 30 feet. The burst resembles a sky filled with stars. Creatures in the area make a DEX save or take 4d10 radiant damage and become blinded for 1 round. On a success, they take half damage.
At Higher Levels: +1d10 damage per level above 3rd.

You cause a target to hear whispers of pain. The target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, they take 2d8 necrotic damage at the start of each turn. While affected, they are vulnerable to psychic and necrotic damage. They may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 damage per spell level above 4th.

You summon a cloud up to 60 feet above a point within range, creating a 20-foot radius healing rain. Allies who start their turn or enter the area heal 2d8 HP. Non-magical flames in the area are extinguished. You may move the area 30 feet as a bonus action.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 healing per level above 5th.
You create a floating well of light 1 foot off the ground. It has 80 HP and represents a spiritual manifestation. It cannot be targeted or damaged but can be removed via *dispel magic*.
With the caster’s permission (possibly with a set condition, such as "only Good-aligned creatures"), HP can be drawn from the well. Each point healed reduces the well’s HP.

The well disappears after 1 minute or when depleted. A creature may heal up to 20 HP per turn via bonus action by touching the well or being within 30 feet of it, with the caster using an action to direct the healing.
At Higher Levels: +25 HP capacity and +5 healing cap per level above 6th.

setters.set: Holy Water, tas veya aynı işlevi gören tabak

description.p: A powerful divine aura envelops the area. During the casting, nothing unholy or evil can enter or interfere. Life energy surges to its peak, spreading gradually—first into structures, then dead flora, fauna, and finally humanoids. As this energy takes root, life begins to blossom. After half a day, all corpses are restored; by the end of the day, they are revived.
Does not revive powerful souls (e.g., CR 10+), though their bodies are restored. Afterward, they remain unconscious for a week.

Your druidic weapon becomes covered in toxic vines. You make a melee spell attack. On hit, the target loses 10 feet of movement, cannot fly, and takes 1d6 piercing damage whenever it moves. They must use an action to make a STR check against your spell save DC to remove the vines.
At 5th, 11th, and 16th level, both movement and piercing damage increase by 1d6.

A radiant beam strikes a creature you target within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, it deals 2d8 damage and covers their face with stardust, limiting their vision to 5 feet and giving them disadvantage on attacks until the start of their next turn. Taking any damage ends the effect early.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 damage per level above 1st.

You summon a powerful gust in a 10-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line. Creatures in the area make a STR saving throw. On fail: 2d10 force damage, are pushed 10 feet, and fall prone. On success: half damage and are pushed.
At Higher Levels: +1d10 damage per level above 1st.

A 5-foot-wide, 30-foot-long path of divine light bursts forward from you and then returns at the end of your turn. Allies in the path are healed for 1d8. Enemies must make a DEX save or take 1d8 radiant damage. On success, they take half damage.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 healing and damage per level above 2nd.

You target a creature within 40 feet. It heals for 1d10 + your spellcasting modifier. Then, the spell jumps to a target within 15 feet of the first, healing them for 1d8 + modifier, then to another target within 15 feet for 1d6 + modifier, and so on down to 1d4 + modifier. The spell can bounce back to a previously healed target, but the healing is halved.
At Higher Levels: Each level above 4th grants one additional bounce and die tier increase (up to 1d12). At 6th level, each die increases further (e.g., 1d12 → 2d12).

You channel elemental energy and hurl it at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, it takes 3d8 of a chosen type: bludgeoning, cold, fire, or lightning. That creature's resistance to that damage type is reduced by one tier until the start of your next turn.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 damage per level above 3rd.

You strike the ground, causing seismic waves to ripple out in a 40-foot radius. Creatures must make a CON save or fall prone and take 5d8 thunder damage (half on success). Cracks in the ground erupt with flame; creatures must then make a DEX save or take 5d8 fire damage and suffer the Burned condition (half on success). The area becomes difficult terrain.
At Higher Levels: +1d8 thunder and +1d8 fire damage per level above 5th.

As you leap 10 feet backward (without triggering opportunity attacks), you unleash a rain of arrows in a 15-foot-wide, 30-foot-long cone. Creatures in the area must make a DEX saving throw. On a fail, each takes 3d8 force damage and has their movement speed halved until the end of their next turn. Flying creatures in the cone fall a distance equal to their movement speed and have their flying speed reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half damage.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, damage increases by 1d8 per slot level above 2nd, and the backward leap increases by 5 feet per slot level.

Whenever you make a ranged attack with a martial ranged weapon, you may immediately make another ranged weapon attack as a bonus action. The second attack deals additional weapon damage equal to one extra damage die of the weapon.
At Higher Levels: When cast at 4th level, you may make one additional attack (total of two bonus attacks).

You unleash a wave of divine energy centered on yourself in a 15-foot radius. All enemies in the area must make a WIS saving throw. On a fail, they take 3d12 radiant damage; on a success, they take half damage.
At Higher Levels: When cast using a higher-level slot, the damage increases by 2d12 per level, up to 5th level maximum.
For 1 minute, any critical hit against you counts as a normal hit instead. When you cast this spell, you also gain 1d8 temporary hit points.
You protect yourself from incoming attacks. Until the spell ends, you are immune to all weapon and spell damage. You are not protected from environmental or natural sources of damage (e.g., lava).
If you take an offensive action or cast a spell that negatively affects a creature, the spell ends. While under the effect of this spell, your healing spells restore only half as much HP.

Queen's Enchantment (3/day): One creature within 30 ft makes WIS save vs your spell DC. Fail: charmed for 1 minute. Ends if ordered to harm self. Save again at end of turns, with advantage if damaged. Can only charm one target at a time
